{"step_by_step_thinking": "Congenital diaphragmatic hernia is a birth defect where there is an opening in the diaphragm, allowing abdominal organs to move into the chest cavity. This can cause problems with lung development, leading to pulmonary hypoplasia, or underdeveloped lungs. Septicaemia, hemorrhage, and intestinal obstruction are not directly related to this condition.", "answer_choice": "C. Pulmonary hypoplasia"}
